snippet: Five terror suspects were due to appear in U.S. courts on Saturday after their overnight extradition from Britain. The British government is pleased that they are finally gone, but concerns persist about why, in the case of two of the defendants,...
abstract: Five terror suspects were due to appear in U.S. courts on Saturday after their overnight extradition from Britain. The British government is pleased that they are finally gone, but concerns persist about why, in the case of two of the defendants, they were not given an opportunity to face trial at home.

headline.main: British Rights Campaigners Concerned About U.S. Terror Extraditions
